etymologies: Middle English (originally denoting any bright-colored chalcedony other than carnelian): from Old French jasp(r)e, from Latin iaspis, from Greek, of oriental origin. The origin of sense 3 is uncertain

definitions: an opaque reddish-brown variety of chalcedony.
shortDefinitions: opaque reddish-brown semi-precious stone consisting of variety of chalcedony

definitions: a kind of hard fine porcelain invented by Josiah Wedgwood and used for Wedgwood cameos and other delicate work.
shortDefinitions: kind of fine hard porcelain developed by Josiah Wedgwood and used for Wedgwood cameos

etymologies: 1960s: origin uncertain; perhaps from the male given name Jasper (from the similarity in sound between the name and the word wasp)

examples.text: I got stung by a jasper this morning
